title: eeschema: double click on a child-sheet box does not open it anymore (lp:#1833031)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1833031) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
Double-clicking on a hierarchical sheet it does not open it anymore

I don't know if this is the new intended behaviour, so I report it as a
bug.


To reproduce the behaviour:
- Create a new project (or open an existing one)
- add a hierarchical sheet
- double click it. Instead of opening the child schematic it just selects
the box.

If this behaviour is intended... Double clicking was a very quick way to
navigate complex tree-organized schematics, so... I miss that feature.

Cheers,
Dino.

title: eeSchema draws large junctions (weird) (lp:#1833014)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1833014) created by **Brian Piccioni (br0an)**
```
This is a weird one.

eeSchema just started placing slightly larger junction dots. The first was
normal size, then the second and third got bigger. After 2 larger dots, as
soon as I connect the next wire the first larger dot gets "resized" to
normal, then the next dot I make gets enlarged. This pattern continues,
leaving me with 2 large junction dots. They became normal size when I
connected to ground.

I have not changed the size of the junction in the Preferences Display
Options Dimensions: is remains 40.000 mils.

I attached a PDF of screen grabs. Obviously this is not an urgent bug.

title: Tracks in positions which offend DRC, pns router and possibly arc approximation (lp:#1833008)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1833008) created by **eelik (eelik)**
```
I have a tight design with 0402 components and 0.05mm grid. Arc
approximation max err val is 0.001mm. PNS router puts tracks into positions
where they violate DRC. They seem to overlap a bit with the sharp corners
of the clearance outlines which are quite coarse even with the smallest
allowed arc appr max err val. I'm not sure if this can happen when routing
from scratch but I get them when moving the existing tracks with PNS.

title: Option to prevent selecting a footprint on empty area (lp:#1832986)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832986) created by **eelik (eelik)**
```
I often use large footprints which overlap other footprints. Examples are
"motherboards" as footprints when designing "shields" and OLED displays
with pin header connections where components can be placed under the
display.

It's clumsy that I can often select such a footprint by accident. Zooming
in helps sometimes but not always. I would like to have an option (possibly
file format change?) for such footprints which would prevent selecting them
on the empty area inside the bounding box. They could be selected only by
clicking directly on an item of the footprint (pad, graphic lines etc.).
This should include selecting with box selection - only if an item of the
footprint touches the box, the footprint would be selected.

When Edge.Cuts is enabled for footprints this would also make possible
having outlines as footprints. Otherwise accidentally selecting those
footprints will make using them impractical.

description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832930) created by **Tim Trzepacz (softegg)**
```
Pcbnew will frequently crash when I try to use the line tool to draw a
line, especially if that is the first thing I do.
Often it happens within the first few segments I draw, especially if I am
using Eco2.User, Edge.Cuts, or F.Cu layers.
Usually it happens immediately, especially if I draw in Eco2.User first
thing, even if I am editing an empty file. If it doesn't happen in the

has a chance to crash.

title: pcbnew: Clarify DXF Options tooltips (lp:#1832595)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832595) created by **Olivier (oc-spam66)**
```
Hello,

When I output a DXF file from the "Edge.Cuts" layer, the lines produced are
the inner and outer edges of the KiCad line (taking into account the
linewidth). For an edge of the board, two lines are produced in the DXF
instead of one... and none of them is the real edge of the board! Indeed
manufacturers usually consider that the edge of the board is the center
line (linewidth is not a relevant parameter).

Request: The DXF output of "Edge.Cuts" should be made with single lines,
indicating the real edge of the board (i.e. the center line).

Example of use case: One may want to import the DXF produced by KiCad in a
mechanical CAD software, in order to represent the board edge. In the
current situation, it is painful to remove the duplicate lines and correct
for all the shifted positions.

If it is necessary for someone to have the thickness of the line taken into
account in the DXF, a checkbox could give the user the choice of the type
of line to be drawn in the DXF (either one center line, or two external
lines).

Olivier (KiCad 5.1.2)
```

title: Fix for #1831643 breaks MSVC builds (lp:#1832357)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832357) created by **Simon Richter (sjr)**
```
Commit 720889edd seems to fix this bug for Linux builds, but the build
fails because the lexer header files cannot be opened.

Build order seems to be okay, the file is created long before it is used,
so this is likely a problem with the include path (where MSVC is generally
a lot more sensitive), so the fix might have changed project dependencies
and therefore inherited compiler settings.
```

title: "Delete Block" operation deletes unselected components (lp:#1832289)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832289) created by **Dylan (djd9617)**
```
I made a video of the bug here: https://youtu.be/qQVVPzkxb5c
In eeschema, I block select a couple components. If I then move my mouse to
some other place on the schematic, my selected components move with my
cursor as expected, but then when I hit delete or right-click -> delete
block, not only does it delete my block-selected components (which is
expected), but it also deletes all the symbols and wires between where I
dragged my selected block. It seems like after a block selection, the
selection rectangle is still being updated (even though it isn't being
drawn), and when you hit delete, not only is your selection deleted, but
everything in the invisible selection region is being deleted too.

To reproduce: place one symbol in eeschema in the lower right, and one in
the middle of your screen. Block select the lower right component. Move
cursor to upper left. Press delete. Observe that component in middle has
also been deleted.

title: Wish: bitmap2component - Enter dimensions directly instead of resolution (lp:#1832230)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832230) created by **Laurent Haas (efcis)**
```
Currently, to adjust the dimensions of a loaded bitmap, we have to tweak
the resolution, which is not very user friendly.

Also, the resolution is expressed in dots per INCH, while the dimensions
are expressed in MM. Making it worse...

It would be much more efficient to allow the dimensions to be entered
directly instead (and resolution calculated and displayed - read only).
Also a checkbox to maintain ratio (checked by default) and a button to
revert to the original dimensions would be welcome.

title: Page layout editor copy-paste error (lp:#1832211)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832211) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
To reproduce the behaviour:
-Open page layout editor
-File->New to have an empty sheet (not needed)
-Add a new element (tested with line, text and box) to the sheet
-Select it and copy (ctrl-c or right-click menu)
-you get a window with:
   pl_editor information
   Expecting "'number'" in input/source "Sexpr_string" line 1, offset 24

If you try to copy-paste the elements of the default sheet, some work and
same give the same error (with different offset)

Attached a file with just a line that issues the error with copy-paste.

Looking at the file, it seems that the end x coordinate has 14 decimal
digits instead of the six used for start x,y and end y. may be it is
related to this.


Tested on revision
bc096dc4ee9bf2a358d3690f69db52d652670a54
------------------------------------

title: Circular cutout on “edge.cuts” not handled correctly (lp:#1832096)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832096) created by **Olivier (oc-spam66)**
```
Hello,

I drew the contour of a board on “edge.cuts” with three cutouts inside: one
square, one circle, and one circle made of two circle arcs. The result is
correctly rendered in the 3D viewer.

However it seems that KiCad removes the circle from the generated Gerber,
as observed in GerbView. It is replaced by a tiny “D10” code, for which the
drill map doesn’t seem to have an information. This is incorrect.

In comparison, the circle made with two arcs is handled correctly (this is
a workaround to obtain a valid circle). So I think there is a bug in the
handling of circular cutouts:

- I expect the circle to be handled correctly by KiCad
- I expect that it is not changed to a drill (I want it to be milled, not
drilled).

Reference topic on the forum: https://forum.kicad.info/t/circular-cutout-
on-edge-cuts-not-handled-correctly/17474

Best regards,

Olivier

title: eeschema printed, plotted and on-screen output difference on the child sheet labels (lp:#1832081)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832081) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
Looking around for a possible (easy) implementation for  Bug #1830409
(whishlist) I found that

The labels over and under the child sheet block in a hierarchical schematic
are not always the same.
On screen and in printed version there is the "Sheet: " and "File: " string
prepended, in the plotted version there is not.
Since I don't know if this is intended or not, I report this as a (small)
bug.

This comes from the fact that the string put over the child sheet box in
the schematic is generated differently in different points of the program:

for the on screen string:
sch_painter.cpp line 1299 :        auto text = wxT( "Sheet: " ) +
aSheet->GetName();

For something else (i did not find where this is used, but I'm not very
expert on this source code)
sch_sheet.cpp line 458  :    Text = wxT( "Sheet: " ) + m_name;

for the "print"
sch_sheet.cpp line 484:    wxString text    = wxT( "Sheet: " ) + m_name;

for the "plot" version there is no "Sheet: " string prepended to sheet
name, so I did not find it using a simple "grep Sheet\: *.cpp" (yet).

P.S.: Putting all of that in a single point of the source code may be
better (no more risk of misalignment if/when the string will change or in
translation).

Cheers.
```

title: Add infix (shortcut trigger action) option (lp:#1832011)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1832011) created by **Julien Faucher (suzizecat)**
```
Hi all,

In latest nigthlies, due to eeschema tool framework rework, most of
shortcuts require a mouse click before or after hitting the shortcut key in
order to be triggered.

In example, to move a component, you have to select it and then hit "M".
Another, to draw a wire, hit "W" and then the first click will start the
wire.

It wasn't the case on pre-5.1 versions (at least) and, in my opinion,
working with KiCAD was way faster due to this feature.

However, since this seems to be a battle topic between users/dev I would
suggest the following :
Add an "Use Infix mode" option (infix comes from Cadence Virtuoso, I don't
really care about the actual name)

This would make all tools triggered upon shortcut use, at the mouse pointer
position. Just how it was done in former KiCAD versions. A key modifier (or
even better, a new set of shortcut) could be used to have a reverted-infix
(use infix in normal mode, use tool trigger in infix mode) shortcut.

I really wish to emphasize on the point that not having this behavior
affect deeply the user experience (IMHO in a pretty bad way, but some won't
agree with me on that).

Finally, this might be extended to PCBNew, in order to have a unified
experience.

Best regards,
Julien FAUCHER
```

title: pcbnew Move item undo stack incorrect (lp:#1831953)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1831953) created by **Seth Hillbrand (sethh)**
```
If you move an item with the mouse and place it, then activate a tool that
changes the item, the undo stack is appended to the original move rather
than having a new step.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Place a footprint on a new board.
2) Use the 'm' hotkey to move it to a new location and place it.
3) Press Ctrl-M to activate the move-exactly menu
4) Move the item again using this menu and click OK
5) Press Ctrl-Z to undo the action

At this point, both actions are undone rather than the single "Move
Exactly" action.  This seems to piggy-back on other actions as well.

title: Pcbnew : Custom text font (lp:#1831898)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1831898) created by **Timothée Manaud (timothee)**
```
I̲s̲s̲u̲e̲:̲
When adding text (silk, copper, mask, etc..) there is only one available
font: the default engraving font (IMHO, not really a nice one).

R̲a̲t̲i̲o̲n̲a̲l̲e̲:̲
Because KiCad is getting known from more and more tinkerer, doing trinkets
without enclosure (the product is the bare PCB itself), it would be nice to
have custom font available to improve the final finish of the PCB, with
fancy labels and custom texts on the silk screen.

W̲i̲s̲h̲e̲d̲ ̲f̲e̲a̲t̲u̲r̲e̲:̲
An option to select any system font for text, on any layer, and correct
plotting feature.

W̲o̲r̲k̲a̲r̲o̲u̲n̲d̲:̲ ̲
create a PNG file (eg from Inkscape) with some text with your custom font,
then convert it to a footprint with the bitmap to component converter, edit
the resulting footprint to select the correct layer with a text editor,
then import footprint (or add it to a empty component to the Eeschema or it
will be removed at the text import).
But this is not acceptable as it requires lot of steps, and is not easily
resizable and the layer cannot be selected.

note: the V6 roadmap announce custom font for Eeschema only.
ps: I've not found related issue, please feel free to link to duplicate or
triage to whitelist
```
Original tags: feature.request pcbnew

description:

```
I have had problems copying and pasting certain individual components,
using the right-click method for both.  The symptom was no-effect when
right-click pasting despite the paste menu item not being greyed out.

Further investigation showed the components (eg. SM resistors) which would
not copy&paste had top-bit-set characters in some of their fields whereas
otherwise identical components without such characters copy&pasted OK. Here
is an example of a problem component
definition;

$Comp

4800 6150 50  0001 C CNN

CRT0805-FZ-1002ELF" V 4800 6150 50  0001 C CNN "Data"
F 5 "RS Stock No. 740-9224" V 4800 6150 50  0001 C CNN "Order code"
        1    4800 6150
        -1   0    0    1
$EndComp

00000190 74 61 22 0a 46 20 35 20 22 52 53 20 53 74 6f 63   ta".F 5 "RS Stoc

Duplication always worked but of course was no use for copying between
sheets.

After some more investigation I discovered changing the LANG setting in my
locale enabled all components to be copy&pasted.  Previously I had
LANG=en_GB (originally needed due to limitations in the window manager I
use).  Changing it to en_GB.UTF-8 fixed the
problem.

See also test.sch attached. With LANG=en_GB set component R8 (with TBS
characters) cannot be copy&pasted but R9 (without TBS characters can be
copy&pasted).  With en_GB.UTF-8 set both components can be copied&pasted.

I know there have been other problems with copy&pasting in the past. Could
I make a feature-request for a diagnostic printed message/GUI pop-up to be
produced when the copy to the clipboard or the paste from it fails, rather
than just silently failing which is
frustrating and not helpful for problem diagnosis?

Thanks
Tom Crane

Ps. this problem was first reported in kicad-
developers@lists.launchpad.net.

title: Implement notification updates for footprint/symbol libraries (lp:#1831755)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1831755) created by **Piotr Gałka (piotrgalka)**
```
I have moved (using file management programm) some footprints betwean
libraries and now the footprint lists showed by Footprint Editor disagree
with files list in directories.
I include screen shots of directory lists and Footprint editor window.

I just don't believe in what is going on. Noticing the problem I have
switched the computer off and on to force KiCad to reread directories. I
have done it twice but with no effect.
I just supposed that KiCad reads the footprint lists from directories each
time I run Footprint editor.

But now during writeing here I should say something - at second computer I
have also the same KiCad version installed but not with my libarary list,
but with ortiginal lists. When I run Footprint editor at that computer it
behaves diferently from day to day. Sometimes it looks that it hangs during
importing footprints at the beginning, but after more than one minute it
finishes and looks OK. Sometimes it takes about 30 seconds to run Footprint
Editor and sometims it looks like it needs no time - just run, and in one
or two seconds it is ready.

Now come back to my working computer (it is not connected to internet so
Windows 7 is not updated since 2 years, but I would not suppose it would be
a source of problem).

Today I decided to move all my PLxxyy.kicad_mod from my S library to my H
library.
I started doing it with KiCad using 'Save as' and 'Delete' - this way I
moved PL0512, PL0513, PL0613. Then decided to move rest faster using file
management program (FreeCommander). I have done it (probably not closing
Footprint Editor, but not sure). And now the situation is as you can see in
attached screenshots.
When I try to enter (double click) the unexisting footprint - just nothing
happenes.
I have reopened Footprint Editor, and whole KiCad several times, I have
swithced off and on computer - no effect.
I tried to find "PL0815" text in my KiCad installation directory and in my
AppData/Roaming/kicad directory to discover where from KiCad can get this
old directory situation. I didn't found.
To be sure I am not cheat by FreeCommander I looked at directory contenets
using Windows Explorer - all files are where I think they are.
The most I am surprised is - where from KiCad could get libabry lists it
showes.
I just don't believe in what is going on.

I plan to move files back, and then move them using KiCad and hope problem
will gone. But certainly something is going wrong.
I have copied kicad_mod files from KiCad libararies to my libraraies many
times duirng last month with absolutelly no problem. After reopening
Footprint Editor the footprint list was updated.

title: DXF import: placement and linewidth should be applied _after_ scaling (lp:#1831496)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1831496) created by **Olivier (oc-spam66)**
```
Hello,

Consider this situation of importing a DXF file in KiCad:
- I would like that the lines are created with a linewidth of 0.15 mm (for
example).
- If the DXF file is in micrometers, it can be imported by setting the
scale factor to 0.001 in the import dialog. However, it is now necessary to
change the linewidth to 150 mm in the dialog, so that it is really 0.15 mm
after the import.

This workaround should not be necessary and is a bit ridiculous. When the
user asks for a precise linewidth, he should obtain what he asked for.

Request: The linewidth should be applied _after_ scaling, not before.

In the same manner, the placement translation should be applied after the
scaling. The user want to place the origin of the DXF in the KiCad space.

Request: The placement should be applied _after_ scaling, not before.


Olivier (KiCad 5.1.2)
```

title: eeschema: "unfold from bus" (right click menu) and "unfold from bus" ("C" shortcut) beheave in a (slightly) different way (lp:#1831466)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1831466) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
The "c" shortcut and the right click menu "Unfold from bus" work a little
bit different:

-Using the right click menu "unfold from bus" if the bus is not "on grid"
the wire-to bus entry does not connect graphically to the bus but goes to
the nearest "in grid point" (I don't know if this should considered a bug
or a feature. May be a warning on the fact it is not on grid should be
appreciated by the user, but I'm not sure on it since it can be personal)
-Trying to do the same using the "c" shortcut gives "no bus selected" even
if a bus has been selected using the mouse, so the (wrong) impression to
the ones who use the shortcuts is that the bus has something wrong or is
not working.

Workaround: place buses on the current grid or try the right-click menu
when you receive a "no bus selected".
```

title: eeschema: BUS definition doubled on copy/paste of child sheet (lp:#1831460)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1831460) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
When a child sheet is copied, its bus definitions are doubled in memory.

To reproduce the behaviour:
-Create a new child sheet
-enter the child sheet
-create a bus definition using tools->bus definitions
-Go up one level to the parent sheet
-copy and paste the child sheet to have two of them
-open tools->bus definitions and now there are two definitions for the same
bus, belonging to the same schematic file.

Saving, exiting and reopening the schematic "solves" the problem (the
definition is back to one, the last created).

Possible data lost: if the first of the two definitions is modified and
different from the second, changes are overwritten by the second while
saving and closing the schematic.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

to a segmentation fault.

I have not been able to come with steps to reproduce. Instead I stripped
down the project where this crash happened to the bare minimum. I included
it in this report.

complete schematic.

happen anymore.

description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1831364) created by **eelik (eelik)**
```
1. Open the symbol editor so that the (system) clipboard is empty.
2. Open a symbol.
3. Context menu->Paste.

KiCad crashes.

There's still the problem which I have reported before that Paste menu item
is active even when there's nothing to paste. I think both the clipboard
content and the context in which the menu is opened should always be
checked to see if the Paste item should be active or not. That would

content.
